articles.headline: Hedge Fund Targets Companies’ Weakness: The Gender Gap
articles.snippet: Ides Capital, led by Dianne McKeever, aims to shake up boards at floundering firms, but it’s also tackling the “boys’ club” mentality it says holds companies back.
articles.abstract: Ides Capital, led by Dianne McKeever, aims to shake up boards at floundering firms, but it’s also tackling the “boys’ club” mentality it says holds companies back.
articles.lead_paragraph: The chief executive at a plastics company was playing golf. A lot of golf.

articles.headline: Xi Jinping May Delay Picking China’s Next Leader, Stoking Speculation
articles.snippet: The apparent plan by the Chinese president has unsettled the party elite and created uncertainty over whether Mr. Xi will try to stay in power beyond the usual two terms.
articles.abstract: The apparent plan by the Chinese president has unsettled the party elite and created uncertainty over whether Mr. Xi will try to stay in power beyond the usual two terms.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — The Chinese president, Xi Jinping, appears prepared to defy the Communist Party’s established script for transferring power and delay the designation of his successor until after a party congress next year, unsettling the party elite and stirring speculation that he wants to prolong his tenure.

articles.headline: Obama Hails Enforcement on Trade Deals to Win Support for T.P.P.
articles.snippet: Actions have been taken against Chinese grain exports, India’s barriers to solar-panel parts, European subsidies for airliner manufacturing and foreign fishing subsidies.
articles.abstract: Actions have been taken against Chinese grain exports, India’s barriers to solar-panel parts, European subsidies for airliner manufacturing and foreign fishing subsidies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration has used a flurry of tough-sounding trade enforcement announcements in recent weeks to counter complaints from the left and right that free trade is not fair trade — and to assist President Obama in the struggle to win approval of his trade pact with 11 Pacific Rim nations.

articles.headline: U.S. Election Cycle Offers Kremlin a Window of Opportunity in Syria
articles.snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin, analysts say, is advancing goals in the Syrian conflict while President Obama is on the way out and his replacement is undetermined.
articles.abstract: President Vladimir V. Putin, analysts say, is advancing goals in the Syrian conflict while President Obama is on the way out and his replacement is undetermined.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Russia is using the waning days of the Obama administration to strengthen President Bashar al-Assad’s hold on power, expand the territory he controls in Syria and constrain the options of the next American president in responding to the civil war, according to a number of American officials and Russian analysts.
articles.byline: By Michael R. Gordon and Neil MacFarquhar

articles.headline: Tim Kaine and Mike Pence Clash Sharply Over Their Running Mates
articles.snippet: No. 2 candidates always use their debates to promote and defend the top of the ticket, but Mr. Pence’s role came after a week of outbursts from Donald Trump.
articles.abstract: No. 2 candidates always use their debates to promote and defend the top of the ticket, but Mr. Pence’s role came after a week of outbursts from Donald Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: FARMVILLE, Va. — Senator Tim Kaine and Gov. Mike Pence repeatedly threw each other on the defensive over their running mates’ policies and character at the vice-presidential debate on Tuesday night, with Mr. Pence making little effort to directly rebut the near-constant attacks on Donald J. Trump’s fitness for the presidency.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Patrick Healy

articles.headline: A French Underground Railroad, Moving African Migrants
articles.snippet: Near the border with Italy, a farmer and his network of “citizen smugglers” have helped hundreds cross the border, in a personal response to his nation’s muddled handling of the crisis.
articles.abstract: Near the border with Italy, a farmer and his network of “citizen smugglers” have helped hundreds cross the border, in a personal response to his nation’s muddled handling of the crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: BREIL-SUR-ROYA, France — On a recent sunny Sunday, about a dozen young men, women and children sat around a wooden table belonging to Cédric Herrou, a 37-year-old farmer, laughing about who would cook that night. It could have been any family-like gathering in the pastoral setting high in the French Alps, just above the border with Italy. But it was not.

articles.headline: MailChimp and the Un-Silicon Valley Way to Make It as a Start-Up
articles.snippet: No venture capital, no Bay Area presence, no crazy burn rate: MailChimp’s founders built the company slowly by anticipating customers’ needs and following their instincts.
articles.abstract: No venture capital, no Bay Area presence, no crazy burn rate: MailChimp’s founders built the company slowly by anticipating customers’ needs and following their instincts.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — The typical start-up fairy tale goes something like this: You begin with young entrepreneurs from Stanford or Harvard who have come up with some novel idea for disrupting restaurants or dog walking or whatever else.

articles.headline: Europe Makes Deal to Send Afghans Home, Where War Awaits Them
articles.snippet: Tens of thousands of Afghans could be deported in the deal, just as the Taliban war has intensified, killing and wounding more civilians than ever.
articles.abstract: Tens of thousands of Afghans could be deported in the deal, just as the Taliban war has intensified, killing and wounding more civilians than ever.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — The European Union and Afghanistan announced a deal on Wednesday that would send tens of thousands of Afghan migrants who had reached Europe back home to an increasingly hazardous war zone.
articles.byline: By Rod Nordland and Mujib Mashal
